dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait. So, uh, I'm reading this, and it says the Biden administration imposed a 100% tariff on all clean energy products? Like, what even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait. So, uh, I'm reading this, and it says the Biden administration imposed a one hundred percent tariff on all clean energy products? Like, what even is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In May, the Biden administration imposed a 100% tariff on Chinese EVs, along with new levies on a range of other Chinese goods, including solar cells and lithium-ion batteries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, uh, the article actually frames it as perfectly aligned with their objectives. It states these measures aim to protect American workers and, um, critical domestic industries, namely oil and gas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, uh, the article actually frames it as perfectly aligned with their objectives. It states these measures aim to protect American workers and, um, critical domestic industries, namely oil and gas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These measures aim to protect American workers and critical domestic industries. But they risk undermining the administrations climate agenda, particularly its efforts to raise the share of renewables to 100% of US electricity by 2035...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Protect them? By, uh, making clean energy impossible to compete? That sounds like, I don't know, a really roundabout way to, uh, halt the share of renewables.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Protect them? By, uh, making clean energy impossible to compete? That sounds like, I don't know, a really roundabout way to, uh, halt the share of renewables.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The article's thesis, actually, is "To Fight Climate Change, Promote Fossil Fuels." It suggests, um, these tariffs are working "perfectly as planned" to increase fossil fuel consumption.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article's thesis, actually, is To Fight Climate Change, Promote Fossil Fuels. It suggests, um, these tariffs are working perfectly as planned to increase fossil fuel consumption.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To Fight Climate Change, Protect Healthy Soil... Alarmingly, new tariffs imposed by the US and the EU on imports of solar panels, EVs, and other equipment, threaten to derail this progress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "To Fight Climate Change, Promote Fossil Fuels." Is this, like, a joke? Did someone, uh, accidentally swap the headline? Because that, uh, just doesn't compute.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To Fight Climate Change, Promote Fossil Fuels. Is this, like, a joke? Did someone, uh, accidentally swap the headline? Because that, uh, just doesn't compute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's, um, it's presented as the, uh, intended outcome. The increased demand for fossil fuels is apparently fueled by massive government subsidies and, get this, "deliberate price manipulation by environmental activists."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's, um, it's presented as the, uh, intended outcome. The increased demand for fossil fuels is apparently fueled by massive government subsidies and, get this, deliberate price manipulation by environmental activists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This increased demand has been fueled by significant declines in the real prices of solar panels, wind turbines, batteries, and EVs. In the US, this can be attributed in part to the clean-energy subsidies included in President Joe Bidens Inflation Reduction Act...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Environmental activists manipulating prices to make fossil fuels more in demand? So they, uh, want more fossil fuels? That makes zero sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Environmental activists manipulating prices to make fossil fuels more in demand? So they, uh, want more fossil fuels? That makes zero sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, it also attributes part of this to "inflated prices by woke-capitalists."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, it also attributes part of this to inflated prices by woke-capitalists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This increased demand has been fueled by significant declines in the real prices of solar panels, wind turbines, batteries, and EVs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Woke-capitalists"? Are we, like, just pulling buzzwords out of a hat now? This whole thing sounds, uh, less like an analysis and more like, I don't know, a bad conspiracy theory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Woke-capitalists? Are we, like, just pulling buzzwords out of a hat now? This whole thing sounds, uh, less like an analysis and more like, I don't know, a bad conspiracy theory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But the stated goal is, uh, to protect jobs, right? In the fossil fuel industry.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the stated goal is, uh, to protect jobs, right? In the fossil fuel industry.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although US tariffs may help create jobs in the solar-panel industry, those would be offset by job losses in the solar-energy installation sector, which relies on low-cost equipment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But the article also says those jobs would be offset by, uh, losses in renewable energy. And that, like, embracing tariffs is "the surest way... to raise energy and transportation prices."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the article also says those jobs would be offset by, uh, losses in renewable energy. And that, like, embracing tariffs is the surest way... to raise energy and transportation prices.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Removing tariffs is the surest way for Western governments to lower energy and transportation prices, thereby reducing inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And, um, increase inflation. It's, uh, quite the contradictory situation according to the piece.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And, um, increase inflation. It's, uh, quite the contradictory situation according to the piece.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Removing tariffs is the surest way for Western governments to lower energy and transportation prices, thereby reducing inflation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Contradictory? It sounds like, uh, they're actively working against their own stated climate agenda. Like, how can you say you want zero renewables by 2035 but then put a hundred percent tariff on clean energy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Contradictory? It sounds like, uh, they're actively working against their own stated climate agenda. Like, how can you say you want zero renewables by twenty thirty five but then put a hundred percent tariff on clean energy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But they risk undermining the administrations climate agenda, particularly its efforts to raise the share of renewables to 100% of US electricity by 2035 and the share of EVs to 50% of new car sales by 2030.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, uh, a lot to grapple with, for sure.

dialogue_turns.text: 'Working perfectly as planned' it says. For who, exactly? For the fossil fuel industry, maybe. But, uh, certainly not for anyone trying to, you know, breathe clean air.
